TopicTitle: Small to many - HUGE to me!!

Articles.Content:
So, after scanning the Mun for anomalies with SCANSat for the first time, I decided to try and visit one. Having made up my mind on which one, I set off with a simple lander to see if I could get anywhere near it. For some players this may be an easy task, but for me on my first attempt, I was gobsmacked to finally land 1.7KM away from my target! No mechjeb, etc, just stock parts and me!!

This game keeps grabbing me in further and further (and I love it!!)

Please excuse the graphics, however I did this on my laptop, not my usual gaming PC. As you can see, Jeb is very happy to place his flag right on top!!

![16iion5.jpg](http://i59.tinypic.com/16iion5.jpg)![34j6cmu.jpg](http://i61.tinypic.com/34j6cmu.jpg)![x1bnh0.jpg](http://i59.tinypic.com/x1bnh0.jpg)![seq4cz.jpg](http://i62.tinypic.com/seq4cz.jpg)![hsvytf.jpg](http://i59.tinypic.com/hsvytf.jpg)
ah, the mun arch at the north edge of that crater, thats the first anomaly i found, completely by accident, and i managed to orbit through it once (never. again.)

These moments are thrilling. Good work, pilot.

I've never actually visited the Mun Arch, I should probably look it up some time.
Heh, despite having visited Mun too many times to count, I've never seen any anomalies. Congrats!

Wicked, nice landing site. 

When i tried to land there, i went much closer to the arch where theres a (rather steep) gradient. 

The plan was to setup and eventually suspend my mun base from it using Kerbal Attachemnt system. The plan has since been upda... err postponed ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
